key_work.title: The Pitch
key_work.brief_description: Films aren’t always plotted from start to finish. In animated films, teams of artists often develop scenes and stories that are then performed to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film. This is the ‘pitch’ and it’s an integral part of storyboarding.

end.title: Ponyo
end.creator_credit: Toshio Suzuki, Lawson, TOHO and Nippon Television Network Corporation
end.brief_description: The son of a sailor, 5-year old Sosuke lives a quiet life on an oceanside cliff with his mother Lisa. One fateful day, he finds a beautiful goldfish trapped in a bottle on the beach and upon rescuing her, names her Ponyo. But she is no ordinary goldfish.

links.description: Storyboarding is typically a time-consuming process undertaken by a team of people. Studio Ghibli’s Hayao Miyazaki, director of Ponyo, chooses to personally draw all the storyboards for his films.

end.title: Shark Tale
end.creator_credit: Janet Healy, Bill Damaschke and Allison Lyon Segan
end.brief_description: Oscar is a small fish whose big aspirations often get him into trouble. Meanwhile, Lenny is a great white shark with a surprising secret that no sea creature would guess: He’s a vegetarian. When a lie turns Oscar into an improbable hero and Lenny becomes an outcast, the two form an unlikely friendship.

constellations_other.name: The Pitch
constellations_other.description: Explore fantastical worlds and underwater seascapes.

links.description: ABZU projects a mysterious and poetic sense of the light, atmosphere and ecology of the ocean world. In contrast, DreamWorks Animation’s Shark Tale uses cartoon-like graphics to turn the creatures of the sea into comical human-like characters.
